column4: Guys, are there any issues with dual booting a computer with two hard drives and using the first for windows and the second for Ubuntu?
I've never done it, so I'm wondering if there are any gotchas
or is it as easy as partitioningo one hard drive?
you just "have" to install grub to the mbr of the harddrive that is set as boot device in bios...
ok, so I install grub on the boot drive.
if you dont use other methods (boot floppy). yes
Ok, would I need a partition on that drive for it, then?
mbr is allready on every hd, you dont need to create it, it just will be overwritten (the ms windows bootloader)
oh, ok. I see what you mean now
MBR = Master Boot Record, i think wikipedia has more info, if you want
How would I typically specify where to install grub?
for mbr, it ask on which hd
ok, perfect
btw, which ubuntu you install ? i remember "old" (dapper?) didnt give you that option thou... meaning the graphicalk installer
I have a dapper CD I was going to use, but maybe I'll try the new (edgy?)
what would you recommend?
im not sure if dapper was "ok", hope someone knows here (i normally use the alternate old text based installer and it "allways" had that option)
what version of Ubuntu would you prefer for a non critical (second development computer) install?
dapper and edgy are stable, dapper just has longer support (and edgy more actual software)
im pretty sure edgy has option (in graphical installer) to select which hd mbr to install
no, the worst that can happen is that it install grub in hd2 mbr, and that is not set as boot hd in bios, so windows bootloader is started from hd1 (if that the boot hd in bios)
right, which would just mean it would boot into windows as normal, right?
yup
